findings.title: Attack surface summary
findings.detail:
groups: open=1, allowlist=1
tools.elevated: enabled
hooks.webhooks: disabled
hooks.internal: disabled
browser control: enabled

findings.title: Reverse proxy headers are not trusted
findings.detail: gateway.bind is loopback and gateway.trustedProxies is empty. If you expose the Control UI through a reverse proxy, configure trusted proxies so local-client checks cannot be spoofed.
findings.remediation: Set gateway.trustedProxies to your proxy IPs or keep the Control UI local-only.

findings.title: Gateway token looks short
findings.detail: gateway auth token is 15 chars; prefer a long random token.

findings.title: Some configured models are below recommended tiers
findings.detail:
Smaller/older models are generally more susceptible to prompt injection and tool misuse.
- openrouter-free/openai/gpt-oss-120b:free (Below GPT-5 family) @ agents.defaults.model.fallbacks
findings.remediation: Use the latest, top-tier model for any bot with tools or untrusted inboxes. Avoid Haiku tiers; prefer GPT-5+ and Claude 4.5+.

findings.title: Small models require sandboxing and web tools disabled
findings.detail:
Small models (<=300B params) detected:
- openrouter-free/openai/gpt-oss-120b:free (120B) @ agents.defaults.model.fallbacks (unsafe; sandbox=off; web=[web_fetch, browser])
- openrouter-free/meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct:free (70B) @ agents.defaults.model.fallbacks (unsafe; sandbox=off; web=[web_fetch, browser])
Uncontrolled input tools allowed: web_fetch, browser.
Small models are not recommended for untrusted inputs.
findings.remediation: If you must use small models, enable sandboxing for all sessions (agents.defaults.sandbox.mode="all") and disable web_search/web_fetch/browser (tools.deny=["group:web","browser"]).

findings.title: Open groupPolicy with elevated tools enabled
findings.detail:
Found groupPolicy="open" at:
- channels.discord.groupPolicy
With tools.elevated enabled, a prompt injection in those rooms can become a high-impact incident.
findings.remediation: Set groupPolicy="allowlist" and keep elevated allowlists extremely tight.

findings.title: State dir is group-writable
findings.detail: /home/thewindstorm/.openclaw mode=775; group users can write into your OpenClaw state.

findings.title: Config file is writable by others
findings.detail: /home/thewindstorm/.openclaw/openclaw.json mode=664; another user could change gateway/auth/tool policies.

findings.title: Credentials dir is writable by others
findings.detail: /home/thewindstorm/.openclaw/credentials mode=775; another user could drop/modify credential files.

findings.title: Discord slash commands have no allowlists
findings.detail: Discord slash commands are enabled, but neither an owner allowFrom list nor any per-guild/channel users allowlist is configured; /… commands will be rejected for everyone.
findings.remediation: Add your user id to channels.discord.allowFrom (or approve yourself via pairing), or configure channels.discord.guilds.<id>.users.

findings.title: Discord security warning
findings.detail: Discord guilds: groupPolicy="open" allows any channel not explicitly denied to trigger (mention-gated). Set channels.discord.groupPolicy="allowlist" and configure channels.discord.guilds.<id>.channels.

providers.error: HTTP 403: OAuth token does not meet scope requirement user:profile
